intro: Pilea roemeri, commonly known as the Chinese money plant, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its round, fleshy leaves that resemble small coins. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish-white flowers that appear in clusters. It is a popular indoor plant due to its ease of care and attractive appearance. Pilea roemeri thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil.
